learning_outcomes.description: Understand basic terms encountered in the vocabulary of aquatic ecosystem science
Describe how water was formed on Earth and the cycles that govern its circulation
Describe the main physical, chemical, hydrological, ecological characteristics of aquatic environments and their main ecosystem services
Apply systems thinking in relation to likely human-environment interactions and impacts
Understand and explain strategies to overcome/prevent environmental degradation of aquatic ecosystems
Demonstrate skills in time management and working independently to complete written exercises on time
Communicate knowledge in an accessible and professional manner in career-oriented oral presentations

assessments.task_description:
This will be 30 online multichoice quizzes covering the content from modules 1 to 3. Quizzes will cover online lecture recordings (available on Blackboard), information provided during practicals, as well as readings and other learning resources made available to students throughout the semester. The online quiz will be short and timed, and students will only have one opportunity to take each quiz. It is the student's responsibility to ensure they have a reliable internet connection and functioning PC/laptop/device to ensure that they do not encounter any technical difficulties during the timed quiz.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quizzes will be open through Blackboard for one week after the end of module 3. Once you start the quiz, you will have 40 minutes. The quiz will automatically submit after 40 minutes. There are no multiple attempts, nor can you interrupt the quiz.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
1) In-class prac quiz 1 - 15/08/2025

2) In-class prac quiz 2 - 5/09/2025

3) In-class prac quiz 3 - 12/09/2025

4) In-class prac quiz 4 - 24/10/2025

5) In-class prac quiz 5 - 31/10/2025
assessments.category: Practical/ Demonstration, Quiz, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
There will be five assessed practicals throughout the semester, one in each module. These will be computer-based and held during your practical time. A short quiz or report will be assigned for each practical.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Practicals and the associated assignments will occur in class in the weeks specified.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This will be 30 online multichoice quizzes covering the content from modules 4 and 5. Quizzes will cover online lecture recordings (available on Blackboard), information provided during practicals, as well as readings and other learning resources made available to students throughout the semester. The online quiz will be short and timed, and students will only have one opportunity to take each quiz. It is the student's responsibility to ensure they have a reliable internet connection and functioning PC/laptop/device to ensure that they do not encounter any technical difficulties during the timed quiz.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quizzes will be open through Blackboard for one week after the end of module 5. Once you start the quiz, you will have 30 minutes. The quiz will automatically submit after 30 minutes. There are no multiple attempts, nor can you interrupt the quiz.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: End of Semester Written Essay Exam
assessments.task_description:
This is a written essay. You will be provided with a choice of essay topics related to the 5 main modules delivered in the course. You will have the whole of semester to work on this essay, and you will be provided guidance on how to research during week 1. The essay will be completed during the end of semester exam period.You will have 3 hours to write your essay and will be allowed to take into the exam notes. More guidance on notes allowed will be provided in week 1.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
